::: grid
::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-lg-4 .top-story-text}
## Deduplicating and linking large datasets using Splink
Data duplication is a ubiquitous problem affecting data quality. Organisations often have multiple records that refer to the same entity but no unique identifier that ties these entities together. Robin Linacre introduces an open source tool, developed by the UK Ministry of Justice, which uses probabilistic record linkage to improve the quality of justice system data.  
:::

Welcome to **Real World Data Science**, a new project from the [Royal Statistical Society](https://rss.org.uk/), in partnership with the [American Statistical Association](https://www.amstat.org/). We bring together data science students, practitioners, leaders, and educators to share knowledge, learn from, and be inspired by real-world applications of data science.
:::

## We want to be a strong voice in the debate on AI because it is underpinned by statistical and mathematical techniques. We have a really important role to play in focusing attention not only on AI outputs but on inputs. That is an area that hasn’t received enough attention but it is one that statisticians understand incredibly well.
Andrew Garrett, president, Royal Statistical Society

![](images/quote-purple.png){width="100px"}

## AI models didn’t invent medicine, accountancy or engineering. They didn’t learn anything directly from the world – human experts taught AI models how to do these things. And they [the human experts] did it without giving their permission, or even knowing that it was happening. The large tech companies have sucked up all of human knowledge and culture and now provide access to it for the price of an API call. This is a huge transfer of power and value from humanity to the tech companies.
Martin Goodson on why we need 'an AI for humanity'
